SEARCH
Package fang2.attributes

Class Palette

java.lang.Object
fang2.attributes.Palette
public class Palette extends Object
This utility class provides easy access to colors by name (either an X Windows named color (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X11_color_names), FANG Blue (the FANG default color), SCG Red (the red used in the first edition of Simple Computer Games) or a hexadecimal string as Web page colors are specified. The colors themselves are modeled using the standard Java Color class.

  • Constructor Details

    • Palette

      public Palette()

  • Method Details

    • addColor

      public static void addColor(String name, Color color)
      Add a color to the list of colors this Palette knows. Lets you define and use your own named colors. Color is specified as a Java Color object.
      Parameters:
      name - the name the color will have in the color map
      color - the color to be added

    • addColor

      public static void addColor(String name, String rgb)
      Add a color to the list of colors Palette knows. Lets you define named colors which you can later use. Color is specified as a Web string "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, and bb are hexidecimal numbers specifying color channel values for red, green, and blue.
      Parameters:
      name - the new color's name
      rgb - the new color's rgb value ("#rrggbb")

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(Color shade, int opacity)
      Create a semi-transparent color from the given color. That is, the R, G, and B channels remain unchanged while the transparency is set to the given value.
      Parameters:
      shade - the color to match (in RGB)
      opacity - the transparency for the new color (0-255)
      Returns:
      color matching given color and given opacity

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(int red, int green, int blue)
      Create a solid color with the given red, green, and blue values.
      Parameters:
      red - red channel value [0..255]
      green - green channel value [0..255]
      blue - blue channel value [0..255]
      Returns:
      color created from the given values

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(int red, int green, int blue, int opacity)
      Create a semi-transparent color with the given red, green, and blue values. All parameter values are clamped to the required range.
      Parameters:
      red - red channel value [0..255]
      green - green channel value [0..255]
      blue - blue channel value [0..255]
      opacity - alpha channel value (higher = more opaque) [0..255]
      Returns:
      color created from the given values

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(String name)
      Create an opaque color from the given name. Names are the entire set of X Windows named colors (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X11_color_names for more information on color names) plus two additional colors, "FANG Blue", the default color used for sprites in FANG and "SCG Red", the red color used in the first edition of Simple Computer Games.
      Parameters:
      name - color name
      Returns:
      matching color if one can be found; FANG Blue otherwise.

    • getColor

      public static Color getColor(String name, int opacity)
      Create a semi-transparent color with from the given name. Names are X Windows named colors (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X11_color_names for more information on color names) plus two additional colors, "FANG Blue", the default color used for sprites in FANG and "SCG Red", the red color used in the first edition of Simple Computer Games.
      Parameters:
      name - color name
      opacity - how opaque the color should be, (higer = more opaque) [0..255]; clamped to the required range
      Returns:
      the color returned by getColor(String) (match or FANG Blue) with opacity set to the given value.

    • getColorFromRGB

      public static Color getColorFromRGB(String rgb)
      Convert a "#rrggbb" string into a Java color object corresponding to the given color.
      Parameters:
      rgb - string of the form "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, and bb are the color channel values for red, green, and blue expressed in hex
      Returns:
      an opaque Color corresponding to the given rgb values.

    • getColorFromRGB

      public static Color getColorFromRGB(String rgb, int opacity)
      Convert a "#rrggbb" string into a Java color object corresponding to the given color.
      Parameters:
      rgb - string of the form "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, and bb are the color channel values for red, green, and blue expressed in hex
      opacity - the opacity of the color [0..255] where 255 is opaque and 0 is transparent
      Returns:
      a Color corresponding to the given rgb and transparency values

    • getColorFromRGBA

      public static Color getColorFromRGBA(String rgba)
      Convert a "#rrggbbaa" string into a Java color object corresponding to the given color.
      Parameters:
      rgba - string of the form "#rrggbbaa" where rr, gg, and bb are the color channel values for red, green, and blue expressed in hex and aa is the alpha channel (or opacity) expressed in hex
      Returns:
      a Color corresponding to the given rgba values.

    • getColorMap

      public static Map<String,Color> getColorMap()
      Get the whole name/color map.
      Returns:
      the name/color map used by this Palette.

    • getColorName

      public static String getColorName(Color color)
      Get the name of the color expressed as a Java Color object.
      Parameters:
      color - the color to name (if possible)
      Returns:
      returns the name for the color (if there is one) and returns NO_SUCH_COLOR otherwise.

    • getColorName

      public static String getColorName(int r, int g, int b)
      Get the name of the given color (specified by red, green, and blue channels.
      Parameters:
      r - red value [0..255]
      g - green value [0..255]
      b - blue value [0..255]
      Returns:
      returns the name for the color (if there is one) and returns NO_SUCH_COLOR otherwise.

    • getColorName

      public static String getColorName(String rgb)
      Get the name of given color (specified as a "#rrggbb" hex string (note that it can safely be a "#rrggbbaa" string, too.
      Parameters:
      rgb - string of the form "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, and bb are the color channel values for red, green, and blue expressed in hex
      Returns:
      returns the name for the color (if there is one) and returns NO_SUCH_COLOR otherwise.

    • getRandomColor

      public static Color getRandomColor(Random random)
      Generate a random color. Uses the parameter random number generator if one is provided. If none is provided, returns null as the random color.
      Parameters:
      random - - a Random object used to generate random numbers; this class is ignorant of other FANG classes so it does not poke around in the current game to find the Random that is there. Callers provide the Random (Game.getRandomColor() does this under the hood).
      Returns:
      a randomly selected color if the parameter is non-null; null otherwise

    • getRGB

      public static String getRGB(Color color)
      Return the Web "hex" string for the color of the form "#rrggbb".
      Parameters:
      color - Java color to get the string for
      Returns:
      String of the form "#rrggbb" where rr, gg, and bb are the hex values for the red, green, and blue channels in color

    • getRGBA

      public static String getRGBA(Color color)
      Return the Web "hex" string for the color of the form "#rrggbbaa".
      Parameters:
      color - Java color to get the string for
      Returns:
      String of the form "#rrggbbaa" where rr, gg, and bb are the hex values for the red, green, and blue channels in color and aa is the alpha (opacity) channel
